oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Canteen of Pvt. Charles E. Sneed
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This wood drum Confederate canteen belonged to Pvt. Charles E. Sneed, Co. F, 4th (Starnes'-McClemore's) Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA. Sneed carved his initials into the canteen. He enlisted November 26, 1861. Co. F was known as "The Williamson County Cavalry." In 1862, they reported to Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest, and fought at Parker's Crossroads and Thompson's Station. Sneed served until February 25, 1865.
